definition: Any of a class of substances whose aqueous solutions are characterized by a sour taste, the ability to turn blue litmus red, and the ability to react with bases and certain metals to form salts.
A substance that yields hydrogen ions when dissolved in water.
A substance that can act as a proton donor.
A substance that can accept a pair of electrons to form a covalent bond.
